document_data.name: Nesher
document_data.symbol: A white hawk-bell on a green field.
document_data.mainbody: The '''Nesher''' ({{Pronounce|neh|SHURR|refs=}}) family was a member of the pantheon of [[Nobility of Waterdeep|Waterdhavian nobility]], ''circa'' the {{YearlinkName|1372}}. They were in the lumber and wood-making business and were keen [[hawk]]-masters.
document_data.Organization: The patriarch of the Nesher clan was Lord [[Laskar Nesher]] from at least the {{YearlinkName|1357}}, to at least the {{YearlinkName|1372}}. His young consort was Lady [[Stelar Nesher|Stelar]] (''née'' Stelar [[Thorp (family)|Thorp]]). Laskar's eldest son and heir was [[Kastonoph Nesher|Kastonoph]]. As of 1372 DR, there were thirty-one members of the noble family. As their business interests involved forestry, they generally revered the goddess [[Mielikki]].
document_data.Activities: The family enjoyed hawking as a sport and as a business venture.
document_data.Base of Operations: [[File:Sea Ward-Nesher Villa.png|thumb|right|270px|''The Nesher family compound (labeled $23) ''circa'' 1372 DR.'']] The [[Nesher Villa]] was a walled compound of one- and two-story buildings surrounding a green space located in the [[Waterdeep/Sea Ward|Sea Ward]] on the southwest corner of the intersection of [[Mendever Street]] with [[Chasso's Trot]]. Just across Mendever Street and down a couple doors was the [[Gundwynd]] family villa. Directly across the alley on the south side of the compound was the towering five-story domicile of [[Hlethvagi Anteos]]. Lord [[Khallos Nesher]], brother of Lord Laskar,The source says that Khallos was the brother of Stelar, but this is not possible since Stelar's maiden name was Thorp. It is assumed that Khallos was her brother-in-law which makes him a brother of Laskar. built a small villa outside of [[Silverymoon]] around the {{YearlinkName|1370}}. He had business interests in [[Quaervarr]].
document_data.Relationships: Lady Stelar was opposed to Lord [[Ultas Maernos]] and his campaign to create a haven for the non-human residents of Waterdeep. She, along with other like-minded nobles, attempted to bring him down through skullduggery, but he was successfully protected by the [[Defenders Three]].{{Cite dragon/211/"I Sing a Song by the Deep-Water Bay"|34}}
document_data.History:
The Nesher family were of [[Chondathan]] descent and the family was ennobled in the {{YearlinkName|1291}}.

Sometime in the early 1370s DR,{{DDTS}} Lord Laskar, Lady Stelar, and Kastonoph attended the disastrous wedding between the [[Lords of Waterdeep|Open Lord of Waterdeep]], [[Piergeiron the Paladinson]], and [[Eidola]] of [[Neverwinter]]. Kastonoph witnessed a [[doppleganger]] attack, foiled an assassination attempt, and learned that his own father was attempting to blackmail the bride-to-be.

A month after the abduction, the majority of Waterdeep's inhabitants thought Piergeiron the Paladinson dead as his spirit was trapped inside a ''[[soul gem]]''. In the weeks that led to the Open Lord's funeral, Laskar Nesher was among ambitious nobles fighting for Piergeiron's position. Neshers stirred public opinion, gave numerous speeches, and even provided bleached [[oak]] panels, rails, and bosses for the [[Palace of Waterdeep]], "out of love for the great Piergeiron." In the month Waterdeep was without an Open Lord, Laskar won support of ten respected merchants and three guilds, as well as made an agreement with [[Boareskyr]] brothers, the [[Boareskyr Bridge]] in exchange for [[High Forest]] lumber, claiming the trade route with [[Kara-Tur]]. Laskar and his consort Stelar were both present during the funeral ceremony. However, Laskar's grab for power was for naught with Piergeiron's recovery soon after.
document_data.Members:
* [[Laskar Nesher]]: Patriarch in the mid–14{{th}} century.
* [[Stelar Nesher]]: Laskar's young consort and a [[wizard]]-in-training.
* [[Kastonoph Nesher|Kastonoph "Noph" Nesher]]: Eldest son and heir of Lord Laskar.
* [[Khallos Nesher]]: Brother of Laskar. Lived in Silverymoon and had logging business in Quaervarr.
* [[Adreinelle Nesher]]: Dowager Matron in [[1355 DR]].
* [[Perryn Raventree|Perryn Nesher]]: Married Lord [[Nandos Raventree]] prior to [[1368 DR]].{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2013)/House Raventree}}
